data.title: Perfectly wonderful!
data.text:
I had never been to the downtown deli before and was pleasantly surprised with the new expanded location!

The five dollar daily special includes a six-inch sub sandwich decide which can be chips pasta salad or potato salad as well as a drink.

I had the Sunday special without ham and added mustard and mayo. The bread was crunchy on the outside and fluffy on the inside the sandwich was flavorful and I picked cheetos. 

I will be back!!

data.title: Awesome place
data.text: A must visit while in hemet, place is clean and welcoming I will be there again soon for sure really enjoyed

data.title: Very good deli downtown
data.text: After a less than decent cup of coffee up the street, I was willing to pay a bit more for good coffee here...so I was pleasantly surprised to get GREAT coffee at a less than donut shop price! This is a friendly and hospitable place with nice interior seating to enjoy your food and drinks.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Daily sandwich special is always delicious and a bargain at $5 including a side and a drink.  Great ambience

data.title: SO LOVE!
data.text: GREAT quality @great price! Woa♡ THE BEST Philly Cheese Steak sandwich n ALL! We CAN taste their LOVE towards their food. Just AMAZING! Can't wait to go back! Thank YOU!!

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: First time here. Pleasantly Surprised!  Felt like I was somewhere other than Hemet.  It's nice to see the changes being made on old Harvard. I remember the sidewalk sales in the 60's. Anyway,  the rolls for the grinders were AWESOME!  Plenty of meat too. And what a deal; the daily special included a half grinder with a side and drink for $5! The same thing with a whole  grinder was only $7! My only complaint was the macaroni salad.  Way too sweet. Homemade would be better.  I'll choose chips for my side next time.

data.title: Best Sandwiches
data.text: The most amazing sandwiches . I don't usually care for sandwiches while eating out but  they make them perfect from the bread , to the balance of what's inside .

data.title: Very good food and nice atmosphere
data.text: We've been here 3X now always around lunch. Every food items from salad to sandwiches to wraps have been very flavorful and filling. The pricing is fair for what you receive and the drink options are also nice. I however have had problems the two times I have tried to modify my order by asking for no onions, tomatos, etc to not be on my wrap or sandwich. I don't know if they don't write it down, or they are just to busy to remember to modify. It does take roughly 20 to 30 minutes each time from getting in line to receiving your food, for deli food.

data.title: Good Food: Sour Puss Help
data.text: My husband and I ate here for an early dinner on a Thursday. I have had the sandwiches "to go" many times, yet I have never "dined in". The place is small however it is nicely decorated. When we went, it wasn't very crowded so we walked right up and were able to place our order. My husband and I are easygoing folk so no RBF (resting B-face) looks from me although I had worked all day. The female associate behind the counter was about as pitiful a worker that I've seen in a very long time. She was gruff, apathetic, and abrupt in her mannerisms and her manner of speech. I certainly hope she is not part of the ownership of this nice little place. It makes me sad because so many nice young people I know would be so appreciative to HAVE a job! That said, about  Miss SOUR PUSS, the food was very good and reasonably priced. We got the Thursday special combo, which was the salami sandwich, chips and a drink for 5.00. My husband liked the food so well he ordered another sandwich for his lunch the following day. One other caveat, if you have an ample backside like me, those little chairs at the little tables are uncomfortable. It is my understanding they are expanding-so I hope they can upgrade the chairs for us sandwich liking wide bodies. By the way, they have a wide selection of coffee drinks-I didn't try them-I guess you'll have to try that out yourself!

data.title: OMG .... The sandwiches and salads are AWESOME!!
data.text: My family and I stopped by when we had an hour to spare between checking wedding venues in the area ....... 5 of us got sandwiches, and 3 of us got salads .... We were so impressed!! My husband and I shared a Ham, Turkey, and Cheese sandwich. The bread was lightly crunchy on the outside, and soft on the insides. Outstanding sandwiches! We were told that we could get either Macaroni salad, Potato salad, or bag of chips, AND a drink for $2 more ... What a deal!!  The salads were only $5.00. We look forward to returning, next time we're in town! LOVED IT!

data.title: Ecellent Sandwiches & Service
data.text: Aso long as this place exists in Hemet I won't be visiting Subway or Jersey Mike's. Sandwiches are old fashioned grinders with crunchy bread, lots of quality meats and fresh produce. Their prices are very good too. Wife and I had The Downtowner and Chicken Avocado BLT. Best grinders we ever had!!!!!

data.title: Excellent Sandwich
data.text: Finally tried this place and were happy we did.  My only regret is that we hadn't gone there sooner.  We each had the special which today was a 6" sandwich with ham, turkey, roast beef, cheese, tomatoes, lettuce and their special dressing, plus chips and a drink for only $5.00 each.  What a bargain.  And everything was fresh and delicious.  The roll the sandwich was made with was warm, slightly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside...perfect!  We will be coming back again very soon.

data.title: Why do they include "Coffee Co." In their business name?
data.text:
I was downtown to attend a fiber art exhibit, and decided to have a cup of coffee here. 

I suppose my first clue should have been that there wasn't even a hint of coffee aroma when I entered the restaurant. I thought perhaps since it was late in the afternoon that they were brewing as customers arrived. Not a chance!  The cup of coffee I received was old and scorched. Too bad because this place is really cute, and the atmosphere is one that would have drawn me to return.

To call yourself a coffee company, and then serve terrible coffee is ridiculous.

data.title: Unlike Most Cafes
data.text: This is a fairly new café and we were pleasantly surprised by the décor and the food.  My husband and I both had sandwiches which were very good.

data.title: Great Sandwiches!!!!
data.text: This place is always crowded but if there's no place to sit, bring the sandwiches home or go to a park to enjoy.  Wherever you eat 'em, you'll love 'em!!!

data.title: Good hole in the wall in Hemet
data.text: They make really good sandwiches. They deserve a try.  I know they have won some awards recently for best business.  Parking is not the best so have an early or late lunch if you want to park nearby.

data.title: Sunny Sammy's!
data.text: This location is just like its food, fresh, bright and light.  Best sandwiches in town with the most relaxing and inviting atmosphere.  Highly recommend!!

data.title: Delightful.  I go often.
data.text: The atmosphere is delightful with rotating displays of artwork by local artists.  The food is great and prices very reasonable.  The staff is friendly.  I love this place and go often, introducing many friends to the delights of Downtown Deli.

data.title: Tiny place with great atmosphere and good food
data.text:
We met friends for lunch at the Downtown Deli. The place was packed. That's always a good sign!

Customers order at the counter, and food is delivered to tables. The lunch special (sandwich, chips and drink) is an excellent value. The sandwiches are large and full, and there is a wide variety from which to choose. The salads are huge. Everything is fresh.

I really liked that they have the work of local artists covering the walls. I also liked the stuffed chairs inside the windows. Downtown Deli is a very colorful, inviting place. 

We waited a long time to receive our food, but it was worth the wait. If they could just speed up the service a bit, I'd give this place 5 stars.

data.title: deli coffee and conversation
data.text: Relax with coffee, tea, and delicious treats. Read while you enjoy a great lunch or invite friends to chat where it's cool. Explore Harvard Street while you are there.
